alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 10:59AM CDT until June 03 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Wilkin and Richland Counties. Snake River AT Alvarado affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red Lake River at Crookston affecting Polk County. Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Marshall, Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. .Recent rains will cause some river points to rise again. Otherwise, most other river forecast points are forecast to continue dropping over the next several days. Drier weather will dominate through the next several days. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD. Agricultural damage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon and continue falling to 17.5 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
